alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued November 01 at 1:21PM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Washington, including the following county, Mason. * WHEN...Through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain over the Olympics tonight through Thursday will produce 2.5 to as much as 4 inches of rain with high snow levels, around 10,000 feet. This rainfall could drive the Skokomish River to near or above flood stage Thursday afternoon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
